intro: Rubus tavensis, commonly known as the Tavensis blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
